snippet: Abdullah al-Senussi, who has been charged with crimes against humanity, also faces charges in Libya and the government insists on trying him in a Libyan court.
abstract: Judges at International Criminal Court order Libyan government to immediately hand over Col Muammar el-Qaddafi’s former intelligence chief Abdullah al-Senussi, who has been charged with crimes against humanity; order rejects Libya's request for more time to argue case for trying Senussi in Libya.
lead_paragraph: Abdullah al-Senussi, who has been charged with crimes against humanity, also faces charges in Libya and the government insists on trying him in a Libyan court.

headline.main: International Court Demands Custody of Qaddafi’s Intelligence Chief
headline.print_headline: Libya: International Court Demands Custody of Qaddafi’s Intelligence Chief

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
